interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/05/04
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vince Gilligan', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Peter Gould', 'Michael Morris', 'Adam Bernstein', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Colin Bucksey', 'John Shiban', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Terry McDonough'], 'Producers': ['Thomas Schnauz', 'Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould'], 'Studio': ['American Movie Classics (AMC)']}
Review Text: This is the ONLY THING WORTH WATCHING on TV and has been the only thing for both seasons.  Unfortunately, I now must wait for season 3.  I'll have to go through the next 10 months without it.  KEEP up the good work, Jonathan, Bob, and Rhee.  I also like the other characters, the acting is very good, but I don't like the kind of characters they represent.  Howard is a p---k.  So is Chuck.  Both are great actors.
Review Title: KEEP up the good work, Jonathan
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Mystery of Edwin Drood
Drama
['Acclaimed screenwriter Gwyneth Hughes brings to life this unfinished tale of obsessive love and betrayal, the last story Charles Dickens would ever write before his death.']
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Diarmuid Lawrence'], 'Producers': ['BBC'], 'Starring': ['Matthew Rhys ("Brothers & Sisters")', 'Julia MacKenzie ("Miss Marple")']}
Great drama!  Don't miss this.
WOW!  Great drama.
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vince Gilligan', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Peter Gould', 'Michael Morris', 'Adam Bernstein', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Colin Bucksey', 'John Shiban', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Terry McDonough'], 'Producers': ['Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould'], 'Studio': ['American Movie Classics (AMC)']}
LOVE this and so does my 85-year-old-mother.  Right now, she is ill and this series makes her laugh and take her mind off her pains.  I know the writers have already thought of this, but I can't wait for the episode when Howard OR Chuck needs James's help so we can see what kind of a person James really is.  Let him show up the other two jerks.  TWO THUMBS UP.  Thanks for not dragging a romance into what should be kept an interesting comedy.  Kim is lovely, but I hope that part stays platonic.  GOOD LUCK WITH SEASON 2.
Gives my ailing mother a reprieve from her illness.  We both LOVE JIMMY
{'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vince Gilligan', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Peter Gould', 'Michael Morris', 'Adam Bernstein', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Colin Bucksey', 'John Shiban', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Terry McDonough'], 'Producers': ['Thomas Schnauz', 'Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould'], 'Studio': ['American Movie Classics (AMC)']}
This is the ONLY THING WORTH WATCHING on TV and has been the only thing for both seasons.  Unfortunately, I now must wait for season 3.  I'll have to go through the next 10 months without it.  KEEP up the good work, Jonathan, Bob, and Rhee.  I also like the other characters, the acting is very good, but I don't like the kind of characters they represent.  Howard is a p---k.  So is Chuck.  Both are great actors.
KEEP up the good work, Jonathan
profile:
User Profile Summary:

- **Content Preference**: Strong affinity for drama and adaptations of literary classics, complemented by a clear appreciation for well-crafted comedies that seamlessly blend humor with character depth. Recent interactions indicate a specific enjoyment of high-quality dramatic series that stand out as must-watch content. 
- **Themes**: Continues to favor narratives featuring complex emotional dynamics, particularly those that explore intricate relationships without traditional romantic plots, reinforcing a clear interest in character-driven storytelling.
- **Quality Focus**: High standards for production quality remain paramount, as reflected in consistent high ratings for emotionally resonant content that delivers both personal fulfillment and communal joy, particularly for loved ones.
- **Engagement Style**: Enthusiastic and positive reviewer, demonstrating a strong emotional connection to the viewing experience. The user actively supports and appreciates the artistic efforts of creators and cast members, evidencing a thoughtful engagement with content.
- **Viewer Demographics**: Prefers English-language productions with accessible subtitles, shaping overall content choices in line with accessibility needs.
- **Additional Interests**: Values critically acclaimed and award-winning productions, emphasizing a dedication to thoughtfully crafted storytelling that resonates on both personal and communal levels.

Overall, this individual exhibits a nuanced preference for rich, character-focused narratives across genres, especially those that avoid conventional romantic themes while showcasing high production values and compelling performances.
